TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1074
TEI.2.document_title: Robert Lewis to Stephen F. Austin, 04-11-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Robert Lewis to Austin, April 11, 1825. Trade and transportation from New Orleans.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1074

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Robert Lewis to Austin, April 11, 1825. Trade and transportation from New Orleans. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Schooner May of Orleans*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Red Fish Bar*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-11-1825">April 11th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned*, DSir,*/p*
*p*If My acquatence are sufficient, I beg leaf to introduce to your acquantence, *person_mentioned*Mr. Jessie Cartwright*/person_mentioned*, from near*location_mentioned* Woodville Misspi*/location_mentioned* a *person_mentioned*planter*/person_mentioned* of hie respectibility. he wishes to become a settler in your *location_mentioned*coliney*/location_mentioned*, you will no doubt, be pleasd with him on acquaitance,—we have had a teadious trip from *location_mentioned*N. Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-14-1825">four weeks yesterday*/date_mentioned* since we left there, we have 36 *person_mentioned*passengers*/person_mentioned*. I have upwards of $3000 in goods some Grocer[io]s for this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and goods for the *location_mentioned*Spanish Market*/location_mentioned*, I am auctions to git them to your *location_mentioned*Town*/location_mentioned* as soon as possable, I should like to have waggons enough to take them all at one trip, in weight I have about 7500 or 8000 lbs. If you could send to waggons to Meet Me at the *location_mentioned*ware house*/location_mentioned* I would take it as a particular favor,—The schooner draws upward of seven feet water she has to be lightened, it will be from 6 to 10 days before we can git to *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Docr. Hunter*/person_mentioned*s,*/location_mentioned* then my good will [be ta]ken [to] • • • [immediately . . . */p* *p*I should like to know by the return of *person_mentioned*Mr. Cartwright*/person_mentioned*, if I could depend on the waggons, if I can, I will send an express on My arrival at *person_mentioned*Docr. Hunter*/person_mentioned*s to let then now what day to meet me at the *person_mentioned*warehouse*/person_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*Robert Lewis */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*P. S. I have a letter for *person_mentioned*Mr. William*/person_mentioned*, from his *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned*, and a Book a Leger or register, */p*
*/div1*
